values:
somewhere between philadelphia and pontiac we let go of the wheel and decodes that a wreck was best for us.  We hid in the ditch from the ambulance all night

thank you for the search party; we just weren't ready to be found

who knew the heights could have such vast depths?
who knew that my veins would dry up this quick?
so afraid, yet secure with every single breath of our battered hearts

ARISE MY LOVE, MY LOVE ARISE!!!

i listened to some b-sides
i liked them
i had buffalo chicken dip
i felt good feelings
i went home
i worked

i have great acquaintances!

come hug me

i just uploaded a live version of "if you could see" on the FRANKLIN PARK purevolume page all the other songs are very old, but this one is from our best friends' wedding last Friday http://www.purevolume.com/franklinpark enjoy

on friends: I take on as many friends as I can handle because I love meeting new people and finding out about their lives. I love to hang out with anyone, but rarely make significant investments into just a few people at a time. My best friend sleeps in my bed with me. on God: I am not ashamed to admit that I am a hypocrite for Christ. I know what kind of person I want to be but I fall short a lot. What most people don't understand is that my shortcomings do not make less of a Christian. In fact, it is those shortcomings that increase my need for grace and Christianity itself. I got over the judgmental phase a while ago, so feel free to ask me any questions. on music: I used to run with the big dawgs. I used to put too much of my identity in music. I used to spend every waking moment composing songs in my head and playing drums on my desk at school. The whole experience for me was about getting into the lives of a lot of people and that definitely happened. No regrets with walking away from it. I have a million friendships because of it. on marriage: There is absolutely nothing else i enjoy more in life. It is so hard to explain how nice it is to have a best friend do everything with me. on family: I have been blessed regarding family. My family disbursed a while agi but I still have my mom and dad. i have been really lucky to have Megan's family in my life for the past 9 years. I feel like I grew up with them. I don't think they realize how awesome of a family they have been to me and how cool it is to have three sisters the same age with string faiths. They have all, especially Jacob, made me feel like a brother to them.

if you haven't found out yet

when someone says ".....I am not the only one that noticed" during a convo

that means they have talked mad smack about you to other people that have "noticed" and a few more people that probably didn't notice prior to being told what you are doing wrong

it is just something i have learned

if a friend uses that line on you, ask them to come to you first next time

Product and Service Mix - hugs, hive fives, smiles, asking people how they are doing, paying attention to people in online environments, life lessons 4. its true... i was 16 when i met the girl i will fall asleep next to and wake up to until i die. it is true that we held hands about 9 years ago and never stopped being in love. i was never really all that great to her, but she stuck around. and for that, i am excited to be the best husband around its true... i used to be into music a lot, but i might have sacrificed the possibility of making it a full time gig by going away to CMU for 5 years and getting a degree. i decided i would like to put myself in a position to provide for someone when the time was right. i had the time of my life and it took getting out of the heights to find who i was and what i wanted to do with my life its true... i am so far from any regret. i would not trade my current life for a life of touring if it meant not having the life i have with megan. 10,000 screaming fans don't compare to dancing in the bathroom in the morning while brushing your teeth and trying to sing at the same time. with megan, i feel like i can't hit a wrong note its true... i am blessed beyond comprehension

live journal is effing back in full effect

dont blink, because it is taking over

the days of 8 million 15 year old flirting with me on myspace is over

i miss the days of annonymous hate posts, depressing entries on 90 percent of my friends lists, lj fights, leaving poll questions and having everyone answer

im ready to bring lj back full force

WHO IS WITH ME

who misses teh old lj days of 40 comments and all these string posts instead of generic "whats up" and "your hot" myspace posts.

OH YEAH BUDDY!!!

LJ IS BACK

its as if i woke up

as if you were all a dream

i was groggy and had that sleep in the corners of my eyes

i thought i wanted to go back to sleep

but now that i am awake, i think ill have a coffee

and some bagels

and enjoy some good television

because i feel like myself

thank God for the morning

and for the dreams that kept me sane

i wish i could package this "thing" called morning

and let all of you get to smell, taste, and feel it

you would leave your lottery life

and taste for the first time

id love to wake you up with a sweet melody

what is this jaded attitude that is developed in musicians and fans towards new music? what is this rift between fans and bands/shows that develops all over the place? why is all new music worse than the old tunes we grew up with? i have gotten caught up in the same cycle. i have been buying a new cd every week with hopes of hearing something fresh that gets me to actually take an old cd out of my car. it all sounds the same to me. it all sounds weak to me. i keep telling myself that the next cd i buy will be THE ONE. i have always been one to get defensive of new music and tell everyone the need to open their ears to a new song. i have always been a believer that music isn't dead and we are all just jaded.
i might be changing my mind
i might agree that as the type of music i once enjoyed has a chance to become mainstream, the bands are overproducing themselves and sacrificing some originality. if i hear one more vocalist trying to sound exactly like taking back sunday i am going to switch to folk music 100%.
Bands I am thankful for 1. Bright Eyes 2. Brand New 3. The Weakend 4. Say Anything 5. Chiodos
Assignment - I need to hear something original. I need to hear a band that doesn't sound like "a mixture of 'punk band a' and 'punk band b'". i need to hear the reason to keep buying albums. i am a sucker for poetry and a good melody. I know bands can be generic and still be really good. I love a lot of them. I just would rather listen to JEW's 'Clarity", "Tell All Your Friends", The Used's self titled, etc. than the "next big thing". have at it

1. cars hits my car, my car hits curb going 65 mph, i am unconscious for anywhere from 10 minutes to 3 hours, family and coppers greet me at hospital, i go home, i become irritable, i still remember only a few minutes from 5pm saturday until 5pm sunday. insurance pays me money, i buy a 2005 red cobalt coupe. hopefully i am still 7EW-J14. nuerosurgeon says my back is messy and that i was born not perfect (go figure). 2. i grab guitar, i sing into 5 dollar mic (a huge upgrade form the 5 cent mic i used the past three years). i make myspace (http://www.myspace.com/thebradkins). i post in live journal, and then people add my myspace as a friend. 3. i made a purevolume account, i get 1,000 friends, check me out 4. i went to the indy 500 because awesome people do things like this. the cars were fast, the engines were loud, and i did not have a hotdog. 5. tennessee oil company!!! uh huh 6. aim=thebradkins

does this thing work still

do i even exist in conversation

i thought this would be a good one because i have always had ideas for soem of my friends to try making music with some new people. If you were able to lock 5 or 6 musicians in a basement for 6 months to make a hit record, who would they be? (local musicians definately apply. if you dont know names, just say "the guitarist from alucard" or something like that) IN RELATED NEWS...
1. GO TOGETHER LIKE A HORSE AND CARRIAGE yeah yeah yeah. im married in a smidget over a month and im getting crazy excited. its mostly family because our families are amazingly huge. I have a small groups of friends that I was able to invite and im crazy excited about that. If we didnt have space for you at the reception that IN NO WAY means we dont really really wnat you at the ceremony. so keep september 4th open and you can come see me get hitched (and cry your 16 year old eyes out hahaha). My babe is unbelievable and I am going to cry my eyes out seeing her walking down the aisle towards me. She is going to be gorgeous!!! 2. CHIODOS DISC I got the new Chiodos disc and it is crazy good. I was able to spend this weekend with The Weakend, Anathollo, and Chiodos and I wish it never ended. It would be a perfect tour because I could never get sick of The Weakend or Chiodos. Trust me, the new disc is worth checking out. 3. SCHOOL so im pretty much a master of business and a bachelor or accountancy. this means i am smart. with this knowledge I am predicting that teh Lions will win 8 games this year. i will miss cmu a lot, but I have too much to be excited about to be sad at all. good friends keep in touch and good times follow me around. 4. LIVING ARRANGEMENTS meg and i are living in sterling heights on 16 mile and dequindre in a pimped out apartment. ill get you the addy asap, but just know that i will be around for years to come. im excited! 5. WARPED TOUR I will not be able to make it due to previous engagements, but keep my memory alive by going up to everyone you know and asking where I am and saying you heard I was there. then go to The Weakend's tent and buy the new shirts. 6. PEPSI ONE drink it!!!

it was the best of times, it was the worst of times hard times - summer is here. for the youngens out there, summer is the best time of the year. for many upperclassmen that live away at college, this is easily the hardest part of the year. neighbors, friends, and roomates are all back in their small towns across the country now. i have another journal to go into detail about this. - megan has graduated and moved home for the summer. if one more person says "but your going to have the rest of your lives together" i will kick them in the jaw. ive lived next door to her for a whole year, seeing her 8 times a day. these four months are going to be extremely hard. she is my best friend and no one can comfort me like she can. great times - i am not extremely down at all though. i get to go home for this next week and see all of my favorite people. if you are anywhere around detroit, keep my cell phone ringing because i do not think i am even going to sleep for the whole week. i allready have so much planned with everyone, so im pretty sure every night is going to be rediculous.thank you everyone that has allready called in anticipation. lets get a keg of diet pepsi/bebsi and dance the night away. - im getting together with a group of guys to play some music tomorrow. while i won't disclose who they are, i will tell you i am crazy excited to grab a mic again - meg and i get to meet up with everyone for some pistons basketball. she can actually get into the sports bars this year! - my roomates up here at central are amazing. we wont have 12 people over every single night in the summer, but we will definately find things to do. i cant wait to take up frisbee golf again. - crappy songs i write and record in one night with a 20 cent microphone and no retakes. itis a rather interesting excercise.(follow link to my myspace account) - im really making it past the deaths of Caleb and Beth. My relationship with God is back on track. Thanks for all the prayers and support. I have incredible friends. sorry for any distance i have had with any of you.
does anyone rememeber the days when erik pendergrass was a little cute boy? go to http://www.geocities.com/greenlego.geo/ for the original nobody special site.
Question of the month that all must answer. If I, Brad Atkin, was not a human, 1. what color crayon would i be 2. what CD would I be 3. what household appliance would I be and/or 4. what kind of ice cream would I be? Give the best or worst reasoning possible for your answer. Even if you have only met me on the internet or only know me for hanging out at lakeside, Im sure you can place some sort of character trait on me.
im coming home today so sit back and watch it crash. let this drill be your judge from now on. your radiance is just beyond your ribcage..
http://www.myspace.com/fromhereonout.com http://www.purevolume.com/fromhereonout

TRUE: FROM HERE ON OUT IS IN THE PROCESS OF BOOKING THEIR LAST TWO SHOWS!! (DEC/JAN) TRUE: IT INVOLVES A REUNION OF THE ORIGINAL BASED ON A TRUE STORY (DANNY, TONY, CAM, JAY, MARIO) TRUE: IT MIGHT INVOLVE A REUNION OF THE ORIGINAL NOBODY SPECIAL (BRAD, ERIK, RJ, JIM, NARDI) RUMOR: IT MIGHT INVOLVE MORE LOCAL BANDS THAT YOU MISS VERY MUCH FALSE: IT IS ON JANUARY 11TH WITH FORDIRELIFESAKE AND FOREVER ENDING (WHO MADE THOSE FLYERS?) TRUE: OH MAN my WEEKend with the WEAKend
most of you know i got to take off to pennsylvania with the weakend the weekend before thanksgiving to watch them play with motion city soundtrack. what most of you dont know is how sweet the trip was. to be honest, I had no idea what to expect. the guys arent like fhoo. i used to take their different personalities as not liking me or soemthing but found out things that few have the ability to find out. these guys are genuine, nice, trustworthy, hilarious guys. its cool how word of mouth is spreading about them and how all the bigger bands know and like their disc. then joe and jim got in a kung fhoo match and punched eachother in the faces rumors are lame. im glad im out of this rumor loop. joe, jim, con, jeff, and drew drew are all happily in love and will continue to drop bombs in your ears for years to come (unless jeff gets pregnant or jim gets shot for peaking in the supina window.) sterling heights is for husslas this hold-em craze is causing me to sell drugs on the side. tuesday and saturday night at "MY HOUSE" (if you havent heard im the preident of the flick. all deals must go through me. my first name is just as sweet as golboe's) saturday was unreal. we had to have a royal rumble in the living room to see which 15 players would be allowed to compete in the uber-tourney. one hun-dough to the winner! once again my flawless play fell victim to the amatuers, haha. jim took home the pot and celebrated by climbing into a "got milk?" tshirt with me and that other brad kid. i was too short so they didnt even know i was in the shirt. i saw people at the 9 and mound show so hey to evryone i saw. "i want my-my money back" the knee'd for a kneecap my left kneecap doesnt exist anymore. its like straight down from my thigh to calf. my knee was hyperextended in the annual "lets hop the fence at utica high and play 11 on 11 and hope we dont break eachother"/"thanksgiving weekend" football fiasco. my life sucks and im disproportionate. etc -erik pendergrass is still faster than me -tom bahri looks great -journeys is for juicy fruities -mary-lou is properly spelled marilu -tony boat's girlfriend wants me to kiss tony while she rubs my back -im still not tall -i love colin m's foam mattress -i used to drum in alucard so watch what you say -im not a playa i just bluff alot -get the new strung out -before i go is "back on top" -west virginia is just silly -i still dont have a kneecap -ive never baked pies with a girl =(

well

its taken over a week to be able to write this entry

and yeah................it will be long

a week ago from last sunday i was on top of my game.  i won poker night with the guys, turned 20 bones into 400 bucks in a day, stayed in the Athenium Suites in Greektown for free and was wined and dined by a big 4 accounting firm, was visited by my favorite men (jim, joe and jeff), and witnessed the lions beat the undefeated falcons on the road to become 3 and 1.

shortly after the end of the game i got a call from megan saying caleb (our little brother.  one of the twins.  just 12 years old) was in the hospital and not feeling so well.  he was weak and throwing up.  first diagnosis was meningitis.  spinal tap came back negative so thye believed it was viral meningitis.  That menat he would be ok in time and his body would fight it off.

around 8pm i got a call from meg saying to get in my car and start driving south to pick up rachel because caleb was in critical condition and moved to the pediatric intensive care unit.  so i drove the longest 2.5 hour drive of my life.  me and rachel, my sister-to-be got to detroit around 10pm to find that caleb had been diagnosed braindead.  after 12 hours they would do tests to see if there was any brain activity.  if there wasnt, they would pull that plug.  

i spent that night in the hospital.  i spent a lot of time in prayer and a lot of time crying.  we sang some worship songs around his bed and prayed for a miracle.  jacob, stacey, rachel, granna, kendra (kims sister), and the boyfriends went home for a couple hours of sleep before the test but kim, jerry, megan, and i stayed the night.  ...not that i could sleep.

and in the morning we found out that caleb passed away.  ive always hated the term "passed away" but i just cnat say caleb died.  it doesnt seem real.  maybe im so distant.  maybe im in denial.  maybe i hate the word "died".  i made a lot of phone calls for the family.  it was hard because noone could believ it was caleb. he was in school that week and even was at soccer practice that thursday.

the visitation was thursday and the funeral was friday.  the spport was overwhelming and the fellowship from our churches at cmu and faith completely surrounded us.

i thought i could write this out but i cant

ill stop here

its frustrating because i cnat express having a complete broken heart.  its not an "i lost my girlfriend" thing

i lost a brother for life.  its hurts in a lot of places

i dunno

im done with this post

<font size="-2">word on the street is that my band broke up

monday we play the shelter for our second to last show

craziness

oh well though, i couldnt stand what we became

fromhereonout was a huge part of my life.  i gave half of my life to it.  its a shame to see it end but it might be time to move on.  yeah, im depressed.  yes, i feel noone will continue ot talk to me.  yes, i will miss it with all of my heart.

but i feel like i did it to have a positive influence on people.  i wanted re.ationships to go past the music and have a good influence opn peples lives.  as a member of the band im represented by its members.

im depressed, im discouraged, im disgruntled, im distant

but i guess things happen

with the proper motivation i will continue to make music,

well, party at my place.  maybe i didnt explain it all so well, but i will as it all unfolds.  a huge piece of me died but i guess ill move on

see you all soon

make sure you keep in touch

hopefully i positively influenced your lives.  that is what i wanted to do.

</font>

1. no show for us this weekend. robbie is now away 2. silver is up on purevolume. stream away. 3. i had no idea who kurt cobain was until a year after he died. i was listening to boys II men at the time. 4. this is my second post in less than a month. pure craziness 5. i found my old basketball trading cards. too bad a traded for all grant hilss and anfernee hardaways. life is tough. 6. yeha i had pogs. my slammers were better than yours. 7. if erik gets the student teaching job at stevenson this year he will be teaching at the school his fellow guitarist goes. even better, if the student teaching turns into a full time job, rob will still be there. how cute. his math teacher can drive him to band practice after school. 8. join myspace. it makes peopel think your better looing than you actually are. trust me it works. 9. seems like a good number to stop at

if you havent heard, the ernie ball stage holds a battle each year for a crazy amount of prizes and some good old recognition. we made the philly stage allready, but would love to show ernie ball, mesa, vans, and the other sponsors that voted us on that people give a care about whats going on in detroit. i got liek 300 people on my friends list. im sure you can take 2 minutes. the more we get helped, the more the rest of the bands around here will. feel free to post the link in your live journal or myspace.
in other, completely non-related news:
i will be at central for another year. the word has gotten aorund for the most part. ive been pretty beat up by teh whole situation. ill save you teh details, but i have to return to central in teh fall to start my masters program (mba). so save up soem gas money cause all of you need to stop pretending youll be visiting and start getting up here. we will definately house 50+ metro detroiters at any given time. so pick your dates, confirm them with me, buy some guacamole doritos and diet cherry coke, and start saving up your gas money.
whos comign to visit? who voted for us? who thinks rob frenette is the hottest man alive? who wants an accoustic recording of silver? p.s. go to best buy and grab coldplays first e.p. or kick yourself when your the last to experience its U.S. release.

1bad news sterling heights im moving up to mount pleasant for 6 weeks to attend two summer classes at cmu ill be living with mike, lee, and barry and going to school monday to friday from 10 till 2pm i will be coming home one weekend only, and it has not been decided yet in light of the tragic events, a bunch of us will be meeting @ fuddruckers at 1pm tomorrow for some good eats and great times together [fuddruckers is located at van dyke and 18. for you easterners, its at the end of 53.] 2come on guys. dont im me and say what bands blow. ill point you to bands that are good for your music style. ill suggust bands. ill tell you straight up what genres im getting tired of, but these bands are all my friends and tring crazy hard. i love them all to death and i want to see them all get ot be great musicians. lets support them because i ws there at one point. 3 4i would love to close out his entry with a tribute to teh rumors that surround my life. a. erik is a racist bastard. correction: he just tells jokes that some peopel dont understand. call his humor dry, but dont call him a racist because of somethign he said three years ago. b. from here on out booked teh 9 and mound hall forever and wont let anyone else play there. correction. we played there twice in a row and dropped the contract cause the place is too expensive. the rumor coulnt be farther from the truth. we are no longer working with "that manager guy" anymore. c. from here on out will only play one show a month and they have to throw it. correction: last month we played three shows in one weekend. one was co-thrown and two were for other promoters. this definately goes against that myth. we are very hard to book because we get liek 30 offers a day, but we do play shows more thna once a month. d. from here on out was extremely hurt by the loss of mike tomei. correction:its always hard losing a member. it sometimes makes me lose sleep. he did leave on weird term. the truth is that he never really fit. we wnated him to because he is an amazing musician. we just know there are peopel with a lot more passion for our music and would die to have been in his shoes and are waiting to try to fill them. we have one guy trying out right now tahst playing everyhting perfect and feels honored just to practice with us. it just wasnt mikes thing. his bro will be playing keys for us from now on. e. im an alcoholic. correction:im a narcoholic. im 22 and have soem dirnks once in a while. all they really are are sleeping pills for me though cause i fall asleep right away. im legal and it has no control over me. not too long ago i gave it up completely for 40 days. thast not the sign of an alcoholic. f. all that other bad stuff about me. correction:im freaking sweet at stuff. see you at fuddruckers or in a while its been a while since i posted so comment the h-e-double hockeysticks out of this post. are there any rumors i forgot?

very important

i need a show to put nor am i (atlanta) on on friday the 14th of may.


this i every important


someone please find some room for this band


they are great

www.brandnamerecords.com for more info

its been a crazy long time i want to give 8 million thank yous to all that applied in my last journal. everyone got the job, except for rob, cause he doenst know how to be polite. FIRST OFF im really excited to see everyone. so if you applied and got the job coem talk to me. i swear i love talking to new people and i wont be a jerk or blow you off (on purpose). i cant wait to play again. SECONDLY AND MOST IMPORTANT so i wnat to help bands out. i have helped a lot of bands by giving them shows or spreading the word. one thing i have always done for the band is merch design so i had this crazy idea of starting a clothing company to go along side my production company. i would sponsor bands form in state and out of state with soem free merch and give peopel in teh area some new stuff to wear. NOW I NEED YOUR HELP. This is something thats up in teh air that i want input on, so vote accordingly on my first shirt. 1) 2) 3) i liek the idea of the clothing, but make soem better designs 4) dont do it Hook me up with a vote and some feedback. see you friday the 23rd 5) EDIT FOR THE FONT HATERS

i am currently taking applications for friends that are going to care about me and miss me while im gone
job description:we dont have to see eachother alot, cause chances are we wont. you just have to be a person that will remind me that im needed back home through instant mesages, emails, comments, phone calls, letters, and crazy big hugs when i return. you just pretend like life doenst go on completely normal without me there. it doesnt matter if i ever met you in person. no experience necessary the pay isnt great, but it helps a homesick guy make it through another semester 1,400 minutes away from home.
anyone interested??

**UPDATE**UPROAR STAGE**
1.friday went sweet. all good sets. we got soem new found brothers form chicago called the audition. $400 bucks or more was stollen. smiles were present. teh hugs were in full effect and teh lyrics were sang clearly. what a greta time 2.saturday was a blast. chicago is the place to be. we sold a lot of cds and made a lot of new fans/friends. we stayed with 13th floor records (the auditions label) and ryan form the audition on saturday night. we are making many plans to return their asap. 3.band got kicked out of paolos basement for rediculous reasons. their loss. our first million goes to buying paolos dog vinny a freaking amazing doghouse. 4.robbie likes girls. how weird. i didnt liek girls until at least 8th grade. wait, is robbie in 8th grade yet? 5.cmu makes me want to slit my throat. i hate classes. i hate being busy. i hate being away from my dad and all my best friends form home. this place is all work, no play, and its killing me. 6.everyone hit me up with at least three bands they love seeing live. i loved having such a unique lineup last friday. i wnat to continue to do it liek that. all the peopel still came, so i wnat them to hear new music. 7.ending now

1.spring break
it best start getting springy and stop bringing the suck by the time i get home tonight.
im home till next sunday. i guess this means its time to see my peoples. my only plans are band stuff so far, which is saturday tuesday and next friday as far as i know.
2.based on a fhoo story
yeha we get to hit the floor like a gerbil that jumped out of its cage next friday with a bunch of sweet people. its seriously bene too long since we played with based ona true story, so you know the whoel band is stoked. make sure you come cause we get to all say peace to this guy right here. i talked to him for a while on the phone the other day. the guy has a head on his shoulders. most importantly he will miss the hack out of all of you. this crazy hurts for him to leave playign shows and seeing everyone. so show up and give him crazy love. he isnt leaving to screw thme over, he is leaving so they can follow their dreams. everythign is happening so fast around here. make sure you grab everyone and head to the show, cause we might be flying out a couple labels taht are interested.
3.job i think i have an accounting job waiting for me. do i take the job and security and 50,000 bucks or do i tour and have the chance of losing it? 4.hair should i cut this crap off? 5.my space yeha i got one. my name is bradkins. find me and you get a prize.

frankly, i feel as cool as a kid with sunglasses and no pants on [and yes that is me]
i cnat express how much we love anyone taht has gone to a show, helped sell merch, bought a cd, listened to us on pure volume, hung out, wrote emails for us, made fun of us in junior high, taken pics, taken video, joined our lj community, worn our shirts, joined the amazing street team, orderedd me cokes at nationals, to all the bands we have played with, etc. etc. i love you guys we got a show friday w/half the battle, forever teh way, and some bands i have yet to meet. we also got a hall show on friday march 12th. you all better be there to bid farewell to based on a true story's guitarist jay. you best be there with your dancing shoes on. drink some tea cause your going to be singing along. so who is and isnt going to be at all these shows??????? if you cant make any, tell me where i cna meet up with you to catch up on life. love, this guy

word on the street is that i need to update this thing because of my crazy week. i dont even know where ot start though. i start with the boring deal first. 1. mama im coming home??? so i get this email from plante and moran on monday stating that internships for this summer are full. this is very bad news because they were my last hope. however, the rest of the email explained how she would liek to talk to me about a full time job. WHAT!!! that owuld mean goign home in august for good, getting some suits, and makign crapy music. wait, accountants can make good music right? the crap thing is that meg was my next door neighbor for next year. hmmmm, we will see this week. im gettign a call back on friday. 2. shows last weekend=superb picture a gym filled to the briim with liek 2,000 kids. picture a high school senior on the mic announcing the band form her eon out and hearing a bunch of peopel cheering. (a lot louder than i ever would expect). picture being me and looking to your left to find rob and mike. picture me looking behind me to see paolo give me the weirdest look ever. "wheres erik". now picture me lookign to the right to see that there is no erik. we were on a basketball court. picture a guy coming in teh door on the other side of the court and strutting over to the band separating 1000 people on each side. yeha thats erik. it seemed plan, that little bastard. but no, he lkes talking to old teachers. it was hilarious to see him walking down and just waving at the kids. the show was good. it was more of a "hey we are still alive and actually play tight shows now" sort of show instead of a good sounding show. it did itspurpose because i met amillion peopel that night first to play was my friend ehab. they were there before us so i busted my chops ot set up, place was allready decently filled and kept getting bigger. before i go did their thing too. a public hanging came on and ripped a new butthole for the naysayers. good music, good stage show, good guys. ill make sure you see more of them. a touring band played because they got stranded by another show. they were called wellington (sp?). we played next. dang, ive you were you know why i loved it. if you werent there, hmmm, i cnat describe the atmosphere so i ownt try. i got to see a million of you. made a lot of new friends through searchign aorund these journals for people that were there. i was all smiles. next came the chiodos bros and you ahve to see these guys to believe it. they have a new sound that you have to hear. sweet melodies, awesome breakdowns, nice guys. 3. purevolume.com hmmm. i htought the crowd response on friday night was unexplainable. well, in the past couple nights we have securely stood at the top spot for unsigned bands in the u.s. by plays. we ahve had second place out of both signed and unsigned for a big part of it. we were lucky enough to get picked by purevolume to be on their front page for a week. i guess peopel enjoyed what they heard and keep listening. we had almost 1900 streams on monday night. that isnt as exciting as what has been happening because of it. i have gotten instant messages from texas, new york, philly, new jersey, utah, ohio, south dakota, and california tellign us we have to come out there. i have gotten emails form promotional companies and clothing companies about promotion and sponsorship. we might have allready landed a clothing sponsor from buffalo. i guess i wnat to say htanks for anyone who has been listening to the songs and thanks to everyone that is making detorit the place for show. you ugys are crazy and bands might start getting out of here. tear. hopefully it keeps getting better.
4. im home on the 20th. this means that a national coney island trip is in store for everyone i know. so round up the troop and order me a diet, ill be there around 10pm.

dont even bother sitting down with me sipping caffiene and trading tales of how weve grown apart in all the small ways that we never realized because if your eyes worked half as much as mine you'd know that this was personal and ill try to keep this just as short as you have been with me cause this civility does twice as much the harrm left drying out and ill try to keep this just as deep as wounds you left in me build you up and watch you fall apart

im home on friday so sit back and watch it crash. let this drill be your judge from now on. your radiance is just beyond your ribcage..

a ghost of the past visited me today

his name was freshman year
he is a bastard

and he wont die

the house was way too crammed

the lives were way too lost

and my stomach dropped ot the floor

i wonder where i would be without my soulmate

sad

sick

tired

buying affection

i want to sleep untill 8 pm

"rock 'n roll lives on" or so says my hand in a kind of washed off sharpie sort of way a very interesting weekend i had i was at home, but whats new. classes blow, and my friends dont. so weekends belong to my lovers; music and friends. friday was teh real deal. who would have thought a show that was booked on wednesday and just told to a couple people over the internet would be so sweet. there was a good 130 peoples in there. there was a sweet vibe. first time i saw urgent message and as dawn falls. some sailor band played too. who knows what their names are. the are pretty hot though, in a boys-on-boys sort of way. sunday was rad, not cause the hsow was rad, but soemthings people said to me will be remembered for a long time. i wrote some poepel off that day, but gained a better understanding of some of my friends. the night was complete with a long drive back to cmu with that girl i like and a call from a friend saying his elbow was doing pretty good. (the first part of this entry has been sitting open on my computer since monday, it is now wednesday night so i guess ill finish it.) its snowing a lot (nope, not quite the closer i needed) there we go. i hear based on a true story might play their hit new tune "rescue in the wreckage". i hear from here on out might play a 22 minute version of "drop the system", including 4 synth solos and an erik pendergrass beatbox that will make you wet your long underwear. ill see you in a couple weeks

know me just know me i swear it wont hurt i swear it wont make you bleed im more than a microphone im more than a diamond ring im more than a classmate/roomate/neighbor i have too many lives/situations/homes
love guacamole doritos, counting crows, coldplay, diet cherry coke, madden 2004, talkign all night, wedging my head between megans cheeks and clavicle, open minded people, accoustic guitar, darts, the idea of having children, questions about what i believe, kisses, i know you dont care, but i wish someone did i have two brothers who are 27 and 29 named jeff and matt. jeff has a serious girlfriend named melissa and two dogs. matt has a fiance named laura, a house in columbus, and a job with honda. i am in love with the best thing that has ever happened to me. in september of 2005 my life will change completely and my worries are fading away because i love megan with all my heart my favortie local band is based on a true story. innovative, fresh, true, talented, nice, great friends, respected. finally i have found a brother band taht i cnat get enough of. they give me hope in all of this. i love poetry and photography and graphic design hugs. i hug peopel ive met at least twice. my family is huge to me. peopel need to know and respect the fact that my dad is the best person i have ever met. most peopel that have met him would agree. his support for me in everyhting i ahve done has made me who i am. im done hopefully through this new journal you will find out who i really am. not just the kid who shows up at national or the singer of that band or that kid form church. brad

turn another page..... ....attempted murders have only made me strong im not fond of chains, im not fond of drowning. i guess its time to look for something new.
